div.p: Some of which are very pretty and attended with a moral, and others equally absurd and Childish but all tending to prove their Tartar or Arabian Original especially those alluding to the Creation and the Delluge[.] The sandy Mountain is terminated inby a point of Red and gray freestone which projects near a mile into the Lake and is saurrounded with Rocks chiefly under water, Which would make the doubling of the point very dangerous to Canoes but for the extreme clearness of the water by which you are enabled to see them in time to avoid the consequence[.]

There is not perhaps on the Globe a body of water so clear so pure and so light as that of Lake Superior. It appears as if conscious of its innate excellence; for the innumerable Tainted Streams which pour their Torrents into it, seem as if the offered union was Rejected with scorn, and are forced to an early creep merely along the Beach without once being able to make an impression on the unstained bosom of its crystal flood. There is no better proof of its tightness than the manner in which it becomes Ruffled by the Slightest winds and when a gale blows off the opposite Shore it has been known to raise the water many feet, some hours before its arrival; this is best exemplifyed at the fall, where it oftens Rises 2 or 3 feet in as many minutes and is constantly succeeded by a NorthWesterly wind; on these Occasions a vast quantity of water more than the natural discharge is carried off and will assist to Account for the Lakes Retainying nearly a constant
